text: When using dynamic pages with HubDB - can you have numbers in the page path column? Or will this cause errors?
Interesting question... Did you try it?
Just test it. I am sure it would work though. As long as it is a valid url
Yeah I tried it and it seems to work fine
didn’t know if anyone else had experience with it
Can we get folders or something in HubDB for organizing our Tables? :thinking_face:

Has someone succeed to create a “Member system” with Login/Password in HubSpot ? (native or third-part)
I would like to allow a visitor to create an account that will be linked to his CRM entry
Thanks for your answers
I haven't done something directly as a "member" system, though I have created something that I'd consider a gating mechanism with contact information preventing a page from rendering

Basically, the page has conditional HubL on it that reads the contact property and if that user has a certain param == True, it renders the desired content, otherwise it renders whatever (password prompt, upsell / purchase dialog, whatever)

The only hitch there is password management (which I never dealt with). I just had it so that if they were in the DB and I had ran them through a specific workflow that set the "access" param == true, so long as they were cookied / the HS system recognized their contact record it would work

I'm sure you could do some PW hashing from a form fill if you wanted and come up with an internal system for it. But until they come out with a secured HubDB setup (which I know they're working on) this is the best way I could think of other than rolling with a third-party setup

Re: your Login/Password comment -- You don't actually need a password if the user gives you their email... in the same way that Slack sends "magic links" you could just have the user receive a transactional email from HS with a link that will re-cookie them to allow their {{contact}} object to be visible to the template's HubL (from which you can check if they have the "authorized" field on their profile)

The only bad thing with user authentication is you cant protect files in the HS system so if you have something like special pricing pdfs or anything like that, anyone can share those links and get to them
Thanks for this detailled answer <@U4RP6AGV9>
Aj is right. You would have to house those sources under the protected server.

Thanks <@U38EZFVFE>, <@U2H3TT8F2> and <@U4RP6AGV9>. My client goal is just to create a sort of media with 2 kinds of posts : FREE accessible to everyone and PREMIUM accessible to people who subscribe to a plan. So after a payment (with DepositFix and Stripe for example) my user will access to entire content (no one will be downloadable).

I thought about a login system to get the cookie back even a visitor change his device or navigator and know if a visitor already purchased or not a subscription.
Not sure how this is going to work yet or what it will cost. BUT it sounds like what you are asking for  <https://w.inboundlabs.co/booya>
I will take a look :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks

When did they change the row cloning to clone right below the cloned item vs. on the bottom of the list? I think it makes it harder to find which row you cloned. I wish there was a way to sort or move rows around (other than just the search box).
Agreed re: easier way to filter
Depending on your requirements here and how deep you want to go, something akin to Firebase may be worth considering.
